intro: Luina nardosmia subsp. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth luina, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The subspecies is distinguished by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves, giving it a sleek appearance. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
